item.title: Oil Muted After Ukraine Attacks Russian Oil Tanker
item.description: Oil prices hovered close to their highest level since mid-April as investors weighed the impact of a Ukrainian attack on a Russian-flagged oil tanker.

item.title: Metals Mixed as Weak Demand Meets Tight Supply
item.description: Base metals were mixed, while gold prices fell in early London trade, with worries over demand keeping prices low, though tight supply likely providing a floor to prices.

item.title: US Dollar Recovers From Friday's Falls But Gains Seen Limited Ahead of CPI Data
item.description: The dollar recovered from falls on Friday following a below-forecast rise in non-farm payrolls, but gains will be limited as investors look ahead to key inflation data for July on Thursday, MUFG said.

item.title: Siemens Energy Lowers Full-Year Guidance
item.description: Siemens Energy now expects a net loss of €4.5 billion, while profit margin before special items is seen between minus 10% and minus 8% for 2023, due to mounting challenges at Siemens Gamesa that will cost €2.2 billion.

item.title: German Industrial Production Weakens More Than Expected
item.description: Germany’s industrial output declined 1.5% in June, suggesting weak demand and adding to the likelihood of a slowdown in the eurozone economy ahead.

item.title: Indonesia's Second-Quarter Growth Beat Expectations
item.description: The Indonesian economy expanded more than expected in the second quarter, despite a global economic slowdown and declining prices for its leading export commodities.

item.title: India's Sensex Edges Higher, Led by Industrial, Tech Stocks
item.description: Indian shares were slightly higher, led by gains in industrial and technology stocks, as hopes for earnings growth continued and concerns about inflation eased.

item.title: Yellow, One of the Largest U.S. Truckers, Files for Bankruptcy After Shutting Down
item.description: The bankruptcy follows years of struggles as it tried to address the debt it accumulated through a series of mergers and a $700 million federal Covid-19 relief loan.

item.title: From Twitter to X: Why Musk Is Resurrecting His Favorite Domain
item.description: In late July, Elon Musk shifted Twitter’s name to X, a major change for the brand. But it’s not the first time the tech billionaire has used the URL x.com. WSJ explains what the site’s past could signal about its future.

item.title: Ukraine's Ammunition Chief Battles to Boost Production
item.description: Oleksandr Kamyshin, formerly the head of the state railway company, now faces the challenge of bringing Ukraine’s defense industry up to speed as the war with Russia drags on.

item.title: New Jerseyans Don't Pump Gas. That's Just How They Like It.
item.description: Many Garden State residents are proud to be the last U.S. state to prohibit self-service gas stations.

item.title: Going to Europe This Summer? Brace for Flight Delays
item.description: Wildfires, air-traffic control shortages, strikes and the war in Ukraine have led to more delays than last year’s summer of disruption.

item.title: Senior members of the Biden administration are attempting to persuade Canada to drop its plan to impose a digital-services tax at the start of 2024.
item.description: Senior members of the Biden administration are attempting to persuade Canada to drop its plan to impose a digital-services tax at the start of 2024.

item.title: Airlines in the U.S., Europe and Asia are preparing to reduce some flights and routes temporarily to inspect aircraft affected by the recall of hundreds of Pratt & Whitney jet engines.
item.description: Airlines in the U.S., Europe and Asia are preparing to reduce some flights and routes temporarily to inspect aircraft affected by the recall of hundreds of Pratt & Whitney jet engines.

item.title: Pfizer is hitting a rough spot after its post-crisis Covid-19 sales nosedived and while it waits for new drugs and recent deal-making to pay off.
item.description: Pfizer is hitting a rough spot after its post-crisis Covid-19 sales nosedived and while it waits for new drugs and recent deal-making to pay off.

item.title: Berkshire Hathaway swung to a profit in the second quarter, boosted by its insurance division and strong gains in its massive investment portfolio, while its cash pile swelled.
item.description: Berkshire Hathaway swung to a profit in the second quarter, boosted by its insurance division and strong gains in its massive investment portfolio, while its cash pile swelled.

item.title: The oil patch faces a worsening talent shortage even as oil-and-gas companies post record profits, in a departure from previous cycles in the industry.
item.description: The oil patch faces a worsening talent shortage even as oil-and-gas companies post record profits, in a departure from previous cycles in the industry.

item.title: Yellow filed for bankruptcy and is closing the business, falling victim to mounting debt including a government loan and a standoff with the Teamsters.
item.description: Yellow filed for bankruptcy and is closing the business, falling victim to mounting debt including a government loan and a standoff with the Teamsters.

item.title: Even if Trump violated the Constitution when he pressured Pence not to certify the results of the 2020 election, that doesn't make it a crime, Trump's lawyer said.
item.description: Even if Trump violated the Constitution when he pressured Pence not to certify the results of the 2020 election, that doesn’t make it a crime, Trump’s lawyer said.

item.title: A combined Russian and Chinese naval force patrolled near the coast of Alaska last week in what U.S. experts said appeared to be the largest such flotilla to approach American shores.
item.description: A combined Russian and Chinese naval force patrolled near the coast of Alaska last week in what U.S. experts said appeared to be the largest such flotilla to approach American shores.
